info.name: reancare.default
info.description: This documentation details the default version of the REANCare api.

item.name: service health-check
item.description: API to check the health of the service.

item.name: system admin

exec: pm.test("Admin login: Access token is returned", function () {

request.description:
User login with username/phone/email and password.

'LoginRoleId' is the role id through which user wants to log into the system provided the user has the role.

item.description:
User login with username/phone/email and password.
In this example, system admin logs in.

System admin can perform multiple admin tasks such as - 
1. Add/remove/update api clients.
2. Renew the API keys for the api clients.
3. Perform monitoring and admin tasks through selected set of APIs only accessible to system-admin role.

item.name: Api clients

header.description: Admin user login session token (JWT). Format : Bearer JWT_TOKEN
Default API key for internal clients.

request.description:
Register an API client.

This API will register a new API client and returns the generated 'client code' and 'api-key'. The API key has finite lifetime. By default, it is 1 year from the date of the registration.

item.name: Create an API client - with validity period

header.description: Admin user login session token (JWT). Format : Bearer JWT_TOKEN
Default API key for internal clients.

request.description: Register an API client. This example shows how you can set custom validity period for the API key. This API will register a new API client and returns generated 'client code' and 'api-key'.

header.description: Admin user login session token (JWT). Format : Bearer JWT_TOKEN
Default API key for internal clients.

request.description: Retrieve an API client info by client id.

exec: pm.test("Updated api client is returned", function () {

header.description: Admin user login session token (JWT). Format : Bearer JWT_TOKEN
Default API key for internal clients.

request.description: Update an API client info by client id.

Get the current valid API key for a given client. 

This API uses basic authentication with Username and Password. As a username, one has to add 'Client code' generated during the registration.

exec: pm.test("New api key is returned", function () {

request.description:
Renew API key with a given validity period. If not added, the key will be valid for 1 year.

This API uses basic authentication with Username and Password. As a username, one has to add 'Client code' generated during the registration.

item.name: Users
Register patient- with only a phone number

header.description: API key for client app authentication

request.description:
Registers patient. Phone number is the only mandatory field. The rest of the fields are optional. Phone number has to be specified in this format - 'country-code-phone-number'. e.g. "+91-1234567890".

The typical request body is as follows - 
`
{
    "Phone": "+91-1234567890",
    "Prefix": "Mr.",
    "FirstName": "John",
    "MiddleName": "X",
    "LastName": "Doe",
    "Email": "john.doe@gmail.com",
    "Gender": "Male",
    "BirthDate": "1979-01-01",
    "ImageResourceId": "20fd7e52-0d24-4599-bda5-3ed7be2dd383"
}
`

item.description:
## APIs to manage users

These set of APIs are meant to add/retrieve/update/delete/search users for different types, such as patients' doctors, lab-users and pharmacists.

header.description: Session token (JWT) for the user
API client secret key

query.description: Search string to match address line

Format: float value. 
Start of the range for longitude based search

Format: float value. 
End of the range for longitude based search

Format: float value.
Start of the range for lattitude based search

Format: float value.
End of the range for lattitude based search
Date in format: YYYY-MM-DD. Start of the range for creation date based search
Date in format: YYYY-MM-DD. End of the range for creation date based search
The name of the Parameter to order by

item.description:
## APIs to manage addresses

These set of APIs are used to manage addresses belonging to persons or organizations.
